revised_title: On the Composition of Alimentary Substances and Analysis of Organized Bodies
tldr: The author, William Prout, discusses the composition of alimentary substances and the analysis of organized bodies. He examines the saccharine, amylaceous, and acidic principles in food, providing detailed analyses of sugar, starch, vinegar, and other substances. Prout also introduces the concept of "Protorganized" substances and their role in the organization of matter.
